turns.content: In which country is the International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) headquartered that maintains and tracks world records in track and field events?
The International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) is headquartered in Monaco.
What's the fastest time ever recorded in the 100-meter sprint?

As of August 2021, the fastest time ever recorded in the 100-meter sprint for men is 9.58 seconds, set by Usain Bolt of Jamaica at the 2009 World Championships in Berlin, Germany. The fastest time ever recorded in the 100-meter sprint for women is 10.49 seconds, set by Florence Griffith-Joyner of the United States at the 1988 Summer Olympics in Seoul, South Korea.
Wow, Usain Bolt is incredibly fast! Have there been any sprinters who have come close to breaking his record?

Since Usain Bolt set the world record in the 100-meter sprint in 2009, several sprinters have come close to breaking it, but none have been able to surpass it yet. The closest anyone has come is Usain Bolt himself. At the 2012 Olympic Games in London, Bolt ran the 100-meter final in 9.63 seconds, which is the second-fastest time ever recorded. However, this was still 0.05 seconds slower than his own world record. Other fast sprinters like Justin Gatlin, Christian Coleman, and Yohan Blake have also come close to breaking the world record, but they have not been able to do so yet.

It's truly remarkable how Usain Bolt was able to break not only the world record for the 100-meter sprint but also for the 200-meter sprint. Do you think anyone will ever be able to break both of his records?

It is quite remarkable that Usain Bolt was able to break not only the world record for the 100-meter sprint but also for the 200-meter sprint. It would be very difficult for anyone to break both of his records since he is widely considered to be the greatest sprinter of all time. However, in sports, anything is possible, and there are always new athletes coming up who have the potential to challenge existing records.
